metadata.title: ScienceDirect Intensive care admission for Coronavirus OC43 respiratory tract infections Admissions en réanimation pour infection respiratoire à Coronavirus OC43

abstract.original_text: Background. -Coronavirus OC43 infection causes severe pneumonia in patients presenting with comorbidities, but clinical signs alone do not allow for viral identification.

sentences.segment_text: - Coronavirus OC43 infection causes severe pneumonia in patients presenting with comorbidities ,
but clinical signs alone do not allow for viral identification .

abstract.original_text: Objectives. -To analyze acute manifestations of Coronavirus OC43 infections and outcomes of patients admitted to an intensive care unit (ICU). Patients and methods. -Retrospective and monocentric study performed during a Coronavirus OC43 outbreak. We used multiplex PCR to detect an OC43 outbreak in Reunion Island during the 2016 Southern Hemisphere's winter: seven admissions to the ICU. Results. -Mean age of patients was 71 [67;76] years, SAPS II was 42 [28;53], pneumonia severity index 159 [139;182] vs 73 [40.5

- Retrospective and monocentric study performed during a Coronavirus OC43 outbreak .
We used multiplex PCR to detect an OC43 outbreak in Reunion Island during the 2016 Southern Hemisphere 's winter : seven admissions to the ICU .

abstract.original_text: ;107] for patients in medical wards, and 43% required mechanical ventilation. Comorbidities were diabetes mellitus (87%), chronic respiratory failure (57%), and chronic renal failure (29%). One patient died from Haemophilus influenzae co-infection.

sentences.segment_text: One patient died from Haemophilus influenzae co-infection .

abstract.original_text: Conclusion. -As for MERS Co-V infections, underlying comorbidities impacted the clinical outcomes of OC43 infections.

sentences.segment_text: underlying comorbidities impacted the clinical outcomes of OC43 infections .
